description: During an MSNBC interview, former Governor Andrew Cuomo mispronounced mayoral candidate Zohran Mamdani's name as 'Mandami'. Journalist Anand Giridharadas corrected Cuomo, emphasizing the importance of respecting names in a diverse city. "First of all, governor, it's Mamdani. This is a very big, diverse city you want to lead. We should get the names right," Giridharadas said.

title: Iranian leader slammed after daughter’s 'strapless' wedding dress goes viral
description: A video of Ali Shamkhani's daughter wearing a strapless wedding gown at a luxury hotel has sparked outrage in Iran. Critics accuse the regime of hypocrisy, contrasting the lavish Western-style ceremony with strict hijab laws enforced on ordinary women. The incident highlights perceived double standards for the elite amidst ongoing crackdowns on women's rights.

Russia and China backed Iran's position, opposing the E3's attempts to reimpose sanctions.

title: 'All sides moved closer to ending war': Zelenskyy calls Trump meeting 'positive'

Zelenskyy believes Trump's engagement could help end Russia's war against Ukraine, though Putin's maximalist demands remain unchanged. The US also expressed interest in expanding economic ties with Ukraine.

title: Another Suu Kyi? Nobel Peace Prize brings added scrutiny for Maria Corina Machado
description: This is where the comparison to Suu Kyi becomes instructive. Suu Kyi’s global reputation was built on non-violence and patient moral authority; her fall from grace came only after she took power and failed to live up to those ideals, most notoriously by defending Myanmar’s army amid the Rohingya genocide. Machado’s scrutiny, by contrast, is coming now — before she has even had a chance to govern.

description: Diwali, the festival of lights, celebrates Lord Ram's return and the triumph of good over evil. Homes glow with diyas and rangolis, filled with sweets and laughter. Beyond its mythology, Diwali signifies dispelling ignorance with knowledge and hatred with love. It's a time for gratitude, forgiveness, and new beginnings, with families uniting and prayers for prosperity.

title: Viral video: Surat teen booked for assaulting cop during raid; bizman father held
description: A businessman's son, Jainam Shah, faces charges for assaulting a police officer during a raid on a birthday party where liquor was allegedly served. The incident, captured on video, led to Jainam's booking under the Bharatiya Nyaya Sanhita. His father, Samir Shah, was previously arrested for liquor possession at the same event.

title: From steam to speed: The journey of Indian railways and the making of modern India
description: Indian Railways began with just 34 kilometres of track in 1853. Today, it runs over 69,000 kilometres, connecting cities, people, and industries across the country. The Hindu’s latest e-book, Moving Millions: The Magic of the Mundane in Indian Railways, traces this 172-year journey from steam engines to high-speed trains, from colonial infrastructure to a national lifeline.

title: “Translators must become writers”: Salma in conversation with Kavitha Muralidharan
description: Tamil writer and MP Salma spoke about the creative and emotional depth involved in translation during a conversation with journalist Kavitha Muralidharan at The Hindu office. She highlighted how Tamil’s unique idioms and cultural nuances challenge translators, yet allow her stories, often centred on Muslim women, to reach global audiences. Salma reflected on the fear she faced after publishing her debut novel, and how translations helped her voice resonate beyond Tamil Nadu. She emphasised that translation is not just linguistic transfer, but a creative act shaped by the translator’s own understanding and sensitivity.

title: Notes & Chords | Amritha Murali on how to appreciate a Carnatic music concert
description: Carnatic musician Amritha Murali, trained in both vocal music and violin from a young age, has carved a niche for herself with her expansive repertoire and deep-rooted classicism. Under the mentorship of R.K. Shriramkumar for over a decade, she continues to evolve as a performer and teacher. Her concerts are known for their rigour and aesthetic consistency, drawing listeners across generations. In this conversation with The Hindu, Amritha reflects on her artistic journey, the discipline behind her craft, and how audiences regardless of familiarity can connect with Carnatic music.

Tipping Point: How India’s solar boom is changing the global energy game
description: India is emerging as a global leader in renewable energy, with solar power driving a major shift in the electricity landscape. In the first half of 2025, solar and wind met the country’s rising energy demand, reducing coal use and emissions. This marks a significant moment in the global energy transition, as renewables overtook coal for the first time. With record growth in solar capacity and a steady rise in wind and hydro, India’s clean energy push is reshaping the path toward net-zero targets.

title: Watch: Inside the Louvre heist: How thieves stole Royal jewels
description: A daring daylight robbery has rocked the Louvre Museum in Paris, as masked thieves stole nine historic jewels from the Apollo Gallery in just seven minutes. title: Bihar polls: Tears & kurta-tearing in oppn camp; disunity mars MGB poll campaign
description: Bihar's INDIA bloc faces internal turmoil as nomination deadlines loom, with partners fielding candidates against each other and no resolution in sight. This discord contrasts sharply with the NDA's robust campaign. Meanwhile, ticket denials have sparked dramatic protests across the state, with disgruntled aspirants expressing deep anguish and betrayal just weeks before polling begins.

title: 26 ‘Thozhi’ hostels under construction across the state, says Minister Geetha Jeevan
After going for AI agents, laying off 4K employees; Salesforce CEO says: AI doesn't have a soul
description: Salesforce CEO Marc Benioff is sending mixed signals on AI's workplace impact. While the company replaced 4,000 customer support roles with AI agents, Benioff claims AI lacks the human touch essential for sales. Despite these cuts, Salesforce is hiring thousands of new salespeople, highlighting a strategic division of AI's application.

title: Google DeepMind CEO Hassabis' clear warning on AI: Don't make the mistake of FB and….
description: Google DeepMind CEO Demis Hassabis warns of AI's critical inconsistency, where advanced systems excel at complex math but falter on simple problems. This 'jagged intelligence' requires breakthroughs in reasoning and planning, not just more data.  Achieving true Artificial General Intelligence, he suggests, is still years away, demanding better testing and benchmarks to overcome these fundamental flaws.

title: Lauren Kyle turns heads in chic NYC night out as McDavid hits road
description: While Connor McDavid's Oilers faced a tough loss in New York, his wife Lauren Kyle captivated fans with a glamorous girls' night out. Sharing stylish moments on Instagram, she showcased elegance and city sophistication, enjoying espresso martinis with friends. Her vibrant presence off the ice highlights the dynamic lives of NHL partners.

title: Mamdani’s message to CEOs of Google, Apple, Microsoft & other tech companies: ‘We are going to …’
description: Democratic mayoral frontrunner Zohran Mamdani emphasized affordability as key to attracting tech companies, stating it enables workers to live and work in NYC.  Meanwhile, independent candidate Andrew Cuomo assured business leaders that anti-business policies are over, vowing to work with companies. Mamdani, however, pointed to corporate greed as pushing out small businesses and workers.
